abstract: Sec of State John Kerry announces plans for training, by United States and India, of troops in six African countries before they are deployed to United Nations peacekeeping operations; agreement is in response to growing demand for effective, professional peacekeeping forces in regions of conflict.
lead_paragraph: The United States and India agreed Tuesday to train troops in six African countries before they are deployed to United Nations peacekeeping missions.

headline.main: India: Deal on Training African Troops
headline.print_headline: Asia; India: Deal on Training African Troops

snippet: The United States and India agreed Tuesday to train troops in six African countries before they are deployed to United Nations peacekeeping missions.
